ETYMOLOGY: From Italian 'lava', derived from Latin 'labes' meaning 'a fall, a sliding, a collapse'. It was first applied to volcanic material by Francesco Serao in 1737, describing a mudflow after an eruption of Vesuvius.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Molten rock that flows from a volcano or fissure, or the solidified rock formed when it cools.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 从火山或地裂中流出的熔融岩石，或其冷却后形成的固态岩石。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The hot lava flowed slowly down the side of the volcano, engulfing everything in its path.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 炽热的熔岩缓慢地沿着火山侧面流下，吞噬了其路径上的一切。
